Title: Class Definition
HTML:
Create a Person

Class Definition

class Person {
  constructor(name, age) {
    this.name = name;
    this.age = age;
  }
  
  introduce() {
    return `Hi, I'm ${this.name} and I'm ${this.age} years old.`;
  }
  
  haveBirthday() {
    this.age++;
    return `Happy Birthday! Now ${this.age} years old.`;
  }
}

Title: Class Inheritance
HTML:
Animal Inheritance Demo

How It Works

Base Class (Animal): Has name and speak() method

Dog extends Animal: Overrides speak() with "Woof!"

Cat extends Animal: Overrides speak() with "Meow!"

Bird extends Animal: Overrides speak() with "Chirp!" and adds fly()

Title: Closure Example
HTML:
Counter with Closure

Each counter maintains its own private count variable through closure. The inner function has access to the outer function's variables even after the outer function has returned.

Code Example

function createCounter() {
  let count = 0; // Private variable
  
  return {
    increment() { return ++count; },
    decrement() { return --count; },
    getCount() { return count; }
  };
}
